item.title: Report X-2024091651
item.description:
Report X-2024091651

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRESPONDING RESPONSE/CONTAINMENT SHEET. RESPONDER BROUGHT SPILL BACK TO THE CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER NOTICED CAP WAS LOOSE ON THE 5 GALLON CONTAINER. RESPONDER CLOSED UP THE CONTAINER BY CLOSING THE CAP UP. RESPONDER PROCESSED CONTAINER WITH LIQUID AS A WHOLE, PROCESSED THE CONTAMINATED DEBRIS AS WELL.

item.title: Report E-2024090560
item.description:
Report E-2024090560

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured by a pallet and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1791-impacted trailer and concrete. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024090542
item.description:
Report E-2024090542

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: S CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0219 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XCH. It was reported approximately 150 gallons of 330-gallon plastic tote released from a 330-gallon plastic tote due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete between dock doors 160-166. Upon the contractor's arrival, personnel observed the released material impacted a 35'x25' area of the trailer floor. Contractor's containerized (3) 55-gallon poly drums with product impacted oil dry, absorbent pads and PPE. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024090049
item.description:
Report I-2024090049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP CAGE BY THE RESPONDER. DISCOVERED IT WAS NICOTINE WITH NO PAPERS/DIAGRAMS ON THE BOX. CALLED SUPERVISOR F OR ASSISTANCE. HE CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER. WE WERE INSTRUCTED TO HOLD ALL CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE UNTIL FURTHER INSPECTION. CONTENTS AR E PLACED IN TOTES WITH LABEL TO HOLD FOR INSPECTION IN THE DMP CAGE. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT- VAPE CONTAINING NICOTINE AND TWO x 1 QUART BOTTLES OF PURE NICOTINE. PART VII- RECOMMENDATIONS/ACTIONS TAKEN TO PREVENT RECURRENCE

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-08
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped for the night and was performing the post trip inspection and opened doors to check load and securement and noticed the box was wet at the bottom and the pallet also had moisture on it. Crew arrived at 1945 and dawned the appropriate ppe and began clean up and repacking of the container. Clean up was completed by 2230 and all absorbent that were used were disposed of appropriately.
